intro: Elaeocarpus multinervosus, commonly known as the multi-nerved elaeocarp, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Elaeocarpaceae and is characterized by its elliptical,革质 (leathery) leaves with prominent venation. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
